results.title: Forces make forms
results.creator_credit: Harry Robin, Peter Wright, FilmFair Communications and Kinex productions
results.brief_description: Unusual and everyday objects and events are used to encourage critical observation and logical association between forces in operation and their resultant forms. Examples of both natural and man-made forces and the forms they create are designed to assist students to become aware of their visual environment. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Robin, Peter Wright, FilmFair Communications and Kinex productions

results.title: Mau Mau. Black man's land: images of colonialism and independance in Kenya
results.brief_description: Images of colonialism and independence in Kenya. A statement on British colonial policy in Kenya, the colony in British East Africa with the largest white population. Deals with the period from 1952 - 1957, when the “Mau Mau” were operating. Narrated by an African whose tone is bitter, the film looks at the Mau Mau from a different point of view.

results.title: The Making of the President, 1968
results.creator_credit: Fritz Rolano, Mel Stuart, Robert Abel and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Provides a penetrating view of the role played in the 1968 presidential election by the war in Vietnam, student unrest, and uprisings in the inner city areas, as it follows the paths of Richard Nixon, Eugene McCarthy and George Romney. Covers Robert Kennedy’s entry into the race and Lyndon Johnson’s withdrawal, the assassinations of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and Robert Kennedy, rioting and bloodshed in Chicago streets during the Democratic Convention. Concludes with coverage of the election and Richard Nixon’s victory over Hubert Humphrey. Based on the book by Theodore H. White. Editing, David Saxon. Narrator, Joseph Campanella.

results.title: The Human journey: the job
results.creator_credit: Jerry Lewton and CTV Television Network
results.brief_description: Examines the possible restructuring of jobs to suit individuals and human nature, to provide responsibility and challenge, and to ease the frustrations currently felt by so many workers.
results.description: Examines the possible restructuring of jobs to suit individuals and human nature, to provide responsibility and challenge, and to ease the frustrations currently felt by so many workers.

results.title: Jazzoo [Short version]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the beauty, colour and activities of a zoo in the early hours of a summer morning. This film illustrates how the filmmaker uses his basic resource - the visual image - without the use of words.

results.title: Winter of the witch
results.creator_credit: Gerald Herman, Thomas Sand, Learning Corporation of America and Parents' Magazine Films
results.brief_description: Nicky and his mother buy an old house where a three hundred-year-old witch lives. Each day Nick brings her the paper and she realizes that everyone is so sad that there is no need to scare them anymore. She becomes the family cook and amazes everyone with her “happiness” pancakes, until her motive is revealed. Based on “Old Black Witch” by Wende and Harry Devlin. Narrated by Burgess Meredith. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Herman, Thomas Sand, Learning Corporation of America and Parents’ Magazine Films

results.title: Life times nine
results.creator_credit: John Watson, Pen Densham and Insight Productions (US)
results.brief_description: An anthology of nine short films, each written and directed by a student (youngest 11 - oldest 15). Each film is a commercial for life, to promote appreciation of being alive. The films in the anthology are BIRD (directed and written by Kimmie Jensen); LIFE, LIFE, LIFE (directed and written by Jordon Hale); TANK (directed and written by Paul Shapiro); GHOSTS (directed and written by Marilyn Becker); PEANUT (directed and written by Ricky Clark); CHESSMEN (directed and written by Melissa Franklin); OLD FOLKS (directed and written by Robi Blumenstein); GROWING UP (directed and written by Celia Merkur) and MUD PUDDLE (directed and written by Andrew File).

results.title: Breath of life
results.brief_description: If breathing stops, the brain can only live three to five minutes. The film shows the importance and technique of mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. It includes the use of examples of emergency situations where this knowledge is applicable. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.description: If breathing stops, the brain can only live three to five minutes. The film shows the importance and technique of mouth-to-mouth resuscitation. It includes the use of examples of emergency situations where this knowledge is applicable. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Thoroughbred
results.creator_credit: John Watson, Pen Densham, Insight Productions (US) and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Opens with scenes of a race meeting, then moves through the whole cycle of a horse’s life: the birth in winter, foals playing in spring, yearlings being taken to sales as autumn approaches, the sales arena and bidding for the livestock, the patient year of training, and lastly, a slow motion race sequence.

results.title: Pasteur's experiments
results.creator_credit: Masaji Hara, Yasuaki Okada and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: A puppet film which shows the history of experiments dealing with the spontaneous generation of life. Demonstrates that microbes do not arise spontaneously from meat. Good for showing the experimental method.
